pull.title: ci: Update Clang in "tidy" job
pull.body:
This PR switches to the latest [IWYU 0.23](https://github.com/include-what-you-use/include-what-you-use/releases/tag/0.23), which is compatible with Clang 19.

The "modernize-use-starts-ends-with" warnings that emerged have been resolved.

The following tasks remain for follow-ups:
- [ ] Enable  the "performance-inefficient-vector-operation" check (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31305).
- [ ] Enable the "performance-unnecessary-copy-initialization" check (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31364).
- [ ] Resolve the new "bugprone-use-after-move" warnings and remove associated `NOLINT` comments.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage & Benchmarks
For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/31306.
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| ACK | [l0rinc](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31306#pullrequestreview-2458343388) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ðŸ‘Ž to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#31061](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31061) (refactor: Check translatable format strings at compile-time by maflcko)
* [#30997](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30997) (build: Switch to Qt 6 by hebasto)
* [#30975](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30975) (Add multiprocess binaries to release build by Sjors)
* [#30906](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30906) (refactor: prohibit direct flags access in CCoinsCacheEntry and remove invalid tests by l0rinc)
* [#26022](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26022) (Add util::ResultPtr class by ryanofsky)
* [#25722](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25722) (refactor: Use util::Result class for wallet loading by ryanofsky)
* [#25665](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25665) (refactor: Add util::Result failure values, multiple error and warning messages by ryanofsky)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Concept ACK, but approach NACK, I think some of the examples can be fixed by removing the "feature" instead of just patching them.

events.body:
@maflcko @l0rinc 

Thank you for your reviews. The PR has been updated per your feedback.

ACK 3e039b7a03bea6e11e994aebe038ebd6ca80aeb8

The latest change:
* Reverted the `CI_IMAGE_NAME_TAG` and added `APT_LLVM_V`.
* Reverted the `CheckAddCoin` and `ExpectSuccess` fixes to avoid collisions with other PRs.
* Updated description to reflect the dependent fix PRs.

comments.body: Given that https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31305 fixes the issue, are we disabling it as a temporary measure?

Right.

It depends on which PR is merged first :)

Not sure about using releases which are basically EOL in less than 6 months after the release branch is created. This requires touching the release branches to bump those along.

My preference would be to use `APT_LLVM_V`
are you sure this is correct? Not that it matters, but isn't it theoretically pessimising in `ExpectSuccess(StrFn(Untranslated("S"), true), {}, Untranslated("S"));`?

This was already removed in the ACK-ed https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30906/files#diff-3d0856e8b7f136c588b229e0cbd3b2e2c309cd097ade0879521daba4e1bb2a33L774-L777, could you please either revert this line or do it in a separate PR, since I think removing it completely is a better fix.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -59,12 +59,11 @@ void ExpectResult(const util::Result<T>& result, bool success, const bilingual_s
 }
 
 template <typename T, typename... Args>
-void ExpectSuccess(const util::Result<T>& result, const bilingual_str& str, Args&&... args)
+void ExpectSuccess(const util::Result<T>& result, const bilingual_str& str, const Args&... args)

comments.body: Similarly to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31305, I've pushed a PR fixing this instead of disabling the check: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31364
This change has been removed from this PR.
This change has been removed from this PR.

comments.body: This change has been removed from this PR.
Seems easier to just fix it right away, instead of touching the line to say to fix it and then fix it in the next commit?

I'm fine either way, but I guess this way it was easier to selectively revert a conflicting fix and leave only the suppression.

But I'd like to understand the reason for the supressions: would the lint problem break CI without them? Since this will still invalidate ACKed PRs if we merge it like this.
